query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Quel color che viltà di fuor mi pinse 2 veggendo il duca mio tornare in volta, 3 più tosto dentro il suo novo ristrinse.
query.result:
**English:**
1 That color which fear of the outside painted for me, 2 seeing my leader turn back, 3 he restrained more quickly within his new thoughts.
**Cornish:**
1 Anlivma henna a wrug an keth vy dhelergh 2 whedhel vyth gweles an dygh my rehedhes, 3 moyha dhesto yn prys yn y bowes nowyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Attento si fermò com’ uom ch’ascolta; 5 ché l’occhio nol potea menare a lunga 6 per l’aere nero e per la nebbia folta.
query.result:
**English:**
4 He stopped attentively like a man listening; 5 for his eye could not lead him far 6 through the dark air and the thick fog.
**Cornish:**
4 Ev ow stevis avel orth avel den a glewas; 5 rag y lygagh na alla bos marnas dhe hira 6 dreus an ayr tewl ha'n niwl tewl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 «Pur a noi converrà vincer la punga», 8 cominciò el, «se non . . . Tal ne s’offerse. 9 Oh quanto tarda a me ch’altri qui giunga!».
query.result:
**English:**
7 "Yet we must overcome the struggle", 8 he began, "if not . . . He did not continue. 9 Oh how long it seems to me before someone else arrives here!"
**Cornish:**
7 "Mes dhe nyns yw bos trehedhes an wragh", 8 ev a dhallethas, "mar nyns . . . Nyns pesyas. 9 Ah, pyth vel dhe'm bys vyth dalleth aral!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 «In questo fondo de la trista conca 17 discende mai alcun del primo grado, 18 che sol per pena ha la speranza cionca?».
query.result:
**English:**
16 "Into this depth of the sad hollow 17 does anyone ever descend from the first circle, 18 who has only lost hope as punishment?"
**Cornish:**
16 "Yn an downder magh a'n konkel trist 17 A dheuth neb a'n kynsa renk po unn, 18 Neb a wra gollys an spyrans avel pennans?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Questa question fec’ io; e quei «Di rado 20 incontra», mi rispuose, «che di noi 21 faccia il cammino alcun per qual io vado.
query.result:
**English:**
19 I asked this question; and he replied, "It is rare 20 that anyone from our circle 21 takes the path that I am on.
**Cornish:**
19 An govyn ma a wrug hemma; hagena "Yn kov 20 A hwra", henna a leveris dhym, "neb a'gan renk 21 A wra gwul an fordh henna a'm ow mos."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ver è ch’altra fïata qua giù fui, 23 congiurato da quella Eritón cruda 24 che richiamava l’ombre a’ corpi sui.
query.result:
**English:**
22 It is true that I was down here once before, 23 summoned by that cruel Erichtho 24 who called the shades back to their bodies.
**Cornish:**
22 Gwir yw ow bewa yn-ma bys ow tos, 23 Yn-dann dhe conjuri gans an Eriton krys 24 A leveris an spyrys dhe'n korfow aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Di poco era di me la carne nuda, 26 ch’ella mi fece intrar dentr’ a quel muro, 27 per trarne un spirto del cerchio di Giuda.
query.result:
**English:**
25 My flesh was still young 26 when she made me enter that wall, 27 to drag out a spirit from Judas' circle.
**Cornish:**
25 Byttegyl o'm korf o'm kig 26 Pan wrug henna ow tos dhe vos yn-mes an mur ma, 27 Rag trehedhes spyrys a renk Judas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Quell’ è ’l più basso loco e ’l più oscuro, 29 e ’l più lontan dal ciel che tutto gira: 30 ben so ’l cammin; però ti fa sicuro.
query.result:
**English:**
28 That is the lowest and darkest place, 29 and the furthest from the sky that turns everything: 30 I know the way well; therefore, be assured.
**Cornish:**
28 Henna yw an le mayha ha'n tywla, 29 Ha'n pella dhe'n nef a dro dhe bub tra, 30 Me a wydh an fordh; rag henna, bydh sur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Questa palude che ’l gran puzzo spira 32 cigne dintorno la città dolente, 33 u’ non potemo intrare omai sanz’ ira».
query.result:
**English:**
31 This marsh that exhales the great stench 32 encircles the sorrowful city, 33 where we can no longer enter without anger.
**Cornish:**
31 An palud ma a spira an sawr meur 32 A wra kledhynk yn-dro dhe'n cita dolurus, 33 Le may nyns yw bos dhe ni dhe vos heb coler."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E altro disse, ma non l’ho a mente; 35 però che l’occhio m’avea tutto tratto 36 ver’ l’alta torre a la cima rovente,
37 dove in un punto furon dritte ratto 38 tre furïe infernal di sangue tinte, 39 che membra feminine avieno e atto,
40 e con idre verdissime eran cinte; 41 serpentelli e ceraste avien per crine, 42 onde le fiere tempie erano avvinte.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And he said other things, but I don't remember them; 35 because my eyes had completely drawn me 36 towards the tall tower with its glowing summit,
37 where in an instant three infernal furies, 38 stained with blood, suddenly appeared, 39 who had the limbs andの姿of women,
40 and were girded with very green hydras; 41 they had little snakes and horned vipers for hair, 42 which entwined their fierce temples.
**Cornish:**
34 Ha leverel erel, mes na'm eus kov, 35 rag an golwg a'm gorra hwans dhe golon 36 dhe'n-nans an tols ughel gans e ben gorrys,
37 le mayth fur yn-mes ughel yn sydyn 38 teyr furï infernal livys gans gwydh, 39 aga oedh esel ha shap benenes,
40 ha gans idras gwer a veu kevys; 41 serpentelli ha kerastes oedh rag blew, 42 hag an templeow gwyls oedh kevys gans an re.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E quei, che ben conobbe le meschine 44 de la regina de l’etterno pianto, 45 «Guarda», mi disse, «le feroci Erine.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And he, who recognized the wretched creatures 44 of the queen of eternal weeping, 45 said to me, "Look, the ferocious Erinyes.
**Cornish:**
43 Ha henna, neb a'n aswon ben an dus, 44 a'n rouanes an gwlas poenans bys vyth, 45 "Sel," ev a leveris, "an Erineow gwyls.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Con l’unghie si fendea ciascuna il petto; 50 battiensi a palme e gridavan sì alto, 51 ch’i’ mi strinsi al poeta per sospetto.
query.result:
**English:**
49 With their nails they tore at their chests; 50 they beat their palms and cried out so loudly, 51 that I clung to the poet in fear.
**Cornish:**
49 Gansoenhegyn yth fennya y'n bys, 50 yth kelli y'n palmys ha'gas ow kul, 51 henna'm a wrug dhe'n bardh rag dowt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 «Vegna Medusa: sì ’l farem di smalto», 53 dicevan tutte riguardando in giuso; 54 «mal non vengiammo in Tesëo l’assalto».
query.result:
**English:**
52 “Let Medusa come: we will turn him to stone,” 53 they said, all looking down; 54 “we did not avenge ourselves badly on Theseus for his attack.”
**Cornish:**
52 “Gwra Medousa: henna a wra ny dhybri,” 53 ow leveris oll ow tos yn-nans; 54 “nyns yw venjans drok war Theseus rag y'n dalleth.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 «Volgiti ’n dietro e tien lo viso chiuso; 56 ché se ’l Gorgón si mostra e tu ’l vedessi, 57 nulla sarebbe di tornar mai suso».
query.result:
**English:**
55 “Turn back and keep your eyes closed; 56 for if the Gorgon shows herself and you see her, 57 there would be no way to return above.”
**Cornish:**
55 “Treyly yn-nans ha kepp dhe'th selwow towl; 56 rag geus an Gorgon a wra'th ow tos, 57 nyns yw fordh dhe'th dhehwel yn-nans.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Così disse ’l maestro; ed elli stessi 59 mi volse, e non si tenne a le mie mani, 60 che con le sue ancor non mi chiudessi.
query.result:
**English:**
58 Thus spoke the master; and he himself 59 turned me around, and did not wait for my hands, 60 to close my eyes with his own.
**Cornish:**
58 Henna a leveris an mester; ha'gas 59 ow treylya'm, ha nyns esa dhe'm dhe'n dhew, 60 rag dhe'n dhew efan nyns esa ow kelmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 O voi ch’avete li ’ntelletti sani, 62 mirate la dottrina che s’asconde 63 sotto ’l velame de li versi strani.
query.result:
**English:**
61 O you who have sound intellects, 62 consider the teaching that is hidden 63 beneath the veil of these strange verses.
**Cornish:**
61 Whelas owth yw dhe'n dheskynnow gwyrdh, 62 sel an gonisogeth a wra kudhys 63 y'n-nans an gwisk a'n gergh termyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 E già venìa su per le torbide onde 65 un fracasso d’un suon, pien di spavento, 66 per cui tremavano amendue le sponde,
67 non altrimenti fatto che d’un vento 68 impetüoso per li avversi ardori, 69 che fier la selva e sanz’ alcun rattento
70 li rami schianta, abbatte e porta fori; 71 dinanzi polveroso va superbo, 72 e fa fuggir le fiere e li pastori.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And now there came over the murky waves 65 a crashing sound, full of terror, 66 at which both banks trembled,
67 no differently from what happens when a wind 68 rushes forth because of opposing heat, 69 which strikes the forest and without any restraint
70 breaks, fells, and carries away the branches; 71 it goes proudly in front, raising dust, 72 and makes the animals and shepherds flee.
**Cornish:**
64 Ha lemmyn ow tos war an tonnow gwynn, 65 un sôn kudhys, leun a spour, 66 ow tos an dhew glannow a dhigon.
67 Nyns yw gwres ughel orth y'n keth, 68 pan wrello an gwynsow ow tos dhe'n ayr, 69 owth a wra'th an koedh ha heb lettya
70 a wra'th an geynnow, a wra'th an prennow; 71 ow tos yn-nans ow tos yn-nans ow tos, 72 ow tos an bestys ha'n merow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Li occhi mi sciolse e disse: «Or drizza il nerbo 74 del viso su per quella schiuma antica 75 per indi ove quel fummo è più acerbo».
query.result:
**English:**
73 He untied my eyes and said: “Now direct the sinew 74 of your gaze over that ancient foam 75 toward where that smoke is thickest.”
**Cornish:**
73 Ow diwrella'm dhe'm dhelergh ha leveris: “Wosa, 74 set dhe'th sel yn-nans war an skumm koth, 75 dhe'n fordh le mayth an fumm yw moyha.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Come le rane innanzi a la nimica 77 biscia per l’acqua si dileguan tutte, 78 fin ch’a la terra ciascuna s’abbica,
79 vid’ io più di mille anime distrutte 80 fuggir così dinanzi ad un ch’al passo 81 passava Stige con le piante asciutte.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Like frogs before the enemy 77 snake, through the water they all scatter, 78 until each one clings to the earth,
79 I saw more than a thousand ruined souls 80 fleeing in this way from one who crossed 81 the Styx with dry soles.
**Cornish:**
76 Kepar an ranow rag an gwiber 77 orth an dowr oll an gorra, 78 bys dhe’n tir yth omma s’abika,
79 mi a welas moy es mil enef distruys 80 ow tos orth rag onan a dremena 81 an Styx gans traow segh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Dal volto rimovea quell’ aere grasso, 83 menando la sinistra innanzi spesso; 84 e sol di quell’ angoscia parea lasso.
query.result:
**English:**
82 From his face he brushed the foul air, 83 often moving his left hand forward; 84 and only from that anguish did he seem weary.
**Cornish:**
82 A’y rudh an ayr tewl dhyworth y rudh, 83 ow tremena y glew dhelergh yn fenowgh; 84 ha nevra dhyworth an angoesh na wra henna dhesempys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Ben m’accorsi ch’elli era da ciel messo, 86 e volsimi al maestro; e quei fé segno 87 ch’i’ stessi queto ed inchinassi ad esso.
query.result:
**English:**
85 I realized well that he was sent from heaven, 86 and I turned to the master; and he made a sign 87 that I should be quiet and bow down to him.
**Cornish:**
85 Da welav vy ben ow tos a veu danvon orth nef, 86 ha treylya vy dhe’n mester; ha henna a wrug merk 87 vy dhe vosya saw ha’n eneval dheso.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Ahi quanto mi parea pien di disdegno! 89 Venne a la porta e con una verghetta 90 l’aperse, che non v’ebbe alcun ritegno.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Ah, how full of disdain he seemed to me! 89 He came to the gate and with a small rod 90 he opened it, for it offered no resistance.
**Cornish:**
88 Ah, pyth vyth ow tos leun a dhisober! 89 Ev dhe’n fordh ha gans gwial byghan 90 ev y agoras, rag na veu neb lettyans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 «O cacciati del ciel, gente dispetta», 92 cominciò elli in su l’orribil soglia, 93 «ond’ esta oltracotanza in voi s’alletta?
94 Perché recalcitrate a quella voglia 95 a cui non puote il fin mai esser mozzo, 96 e che più volte v’ha cresciuta doglia?
97 Che giova ne le fata dar di cozzo? 98 Cerbero vostro, se ben vi ricorda, 99 ne porta ancor pelato il mento e ’l gozzo».
query.result:
**English:**
91 “O you cast out from heaven, despised people,” 92 he began on the horrible threshold, 93 “where does this arrogance nest in you?
94 Why do you rebel against that will 95 whose end can never be cut off, 96 and which has many times increased your pain?
97 What good does it do to struggle against fate? 98 Your Cerberus, if you remember well, 99 still bears his chin and throat peeled from it.”
**Cornish:**
91 “O hwuchys a’n nef, pobel dispris,” 92 ev a dhalleth war an fordh orth, 93 “piw ow tos an ourkomans ma yn fenowgh?
94 Perag orth an wolons na wra y fin 95 bythkweth orth tremena, 96 ha moy troha’th ow kreses an dhogen?
97 Pyth yw gwell orth gorra orth an fat? 98 An Cerberus aga, mar ow tos yn koth, 99 ow porth yth dhelergh y gen ha’n goos.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Poi si rivolse per la strada lorda, 101 e non fé motto a noi, ma fé sembiante 102 d’omo cui altra cura stringa e morda
103 che quella di colui che li è davante; 104 e noi movemmo i piedi inver’ la terra, 105 sicuri appresso le parole sante.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then he turned back along the filthy road, 101 and said no word to us, but showed the bearing 102 of a man who is gripped and tormented 103 by some care other than the one before him;
104 and we moved our feet toward the land, 105 reassured by the holy words.
**Cornish:**
100 Wosa henna ev a droes orth an fordh tewl, 101 ha na wrug ger na’n ni, mes ev a wrug merk 102 den a veu aral sorg a’y grymm ha’y mordh
103 ages an neb a veu rag y’n fordh; 104 ha ni a wayas an traow dhelergh dhe’n tir, 105 seger orth wosa an gerow sans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Dentro li ’ntrammo sanz’ alcuna guerra; 107 e io, ch’avea di riguardar disio 108 la condizion che tal fortezza serra,
109 com’ io fui dentro, l’occhio intorno invio: 110 e veggio ad ogne man grande campagna, 111 piena di duolo e di tormento rio.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Inside I entered without any war; 107 and I, who had a desire to look 108 at the condition that such a fortress encloses,
109 as soon as I was inside, I sent my eyes around: 110 and I see on every hand a great plain, 111 full of sorrow and cruel torment.
**Cornish:**
106 Mesyndhyworthynhebdhresnekter; 107 hagen, ow a vea hiradh dhe weles 108 an keverus ow tressa an krebos ma,
109 pan oen mes, yth kasas y’m lagha a-dro: 110 hagen gweles vy dhe bub tu plen voyn, 111 leun a-dro ha poen kruk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Sì come ad Arli, ove Rodano stagna, 113 sì com’ a Pola, presso del Carnaro 114 ch’Italia chiude e suoi termini bagna,
115 fanno i sepulcri tutt’ il loco varo, 116 così facevan quivi d’ogne parte, 117 salvo che ’l modo v’era più amaro;
118 ché tra li avelli fiamme erano sparte, 119 per le quali eran sì del tutto accesi, 120 che ferro più non chiede verun’ arte.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Just as at Arles, where the Rhône stagnates, 113 just as at Pola, near the Carnaro 114 that encloses Italy and bathes its borders,
115 the sepulchers make the whole place uneven, 116 so they did here on every side, 117 except that the manner there was more bitter;
118 for flames were scattered among the tombs, 119 by which they were so completely kindled, 120 that no art demands hotter iron.
**Cornish:**
112 Dell yw dhe Arli, le may Rodan a-dro, 113 dell yw dhe Pola, ogas dhe Carnaro 114 ow a wra Italia ha’y termennow a-dro,
115 an bezow a wra an le may varya, 116 hemma a wra hemma dhe bub tu, 117 mes an fordh oen o vea moy amar;
118 rag ynter an bezow tanow o vea rann, 119 rag hemma o vea moy a-dro tanow, 120 na’th art a wra moy tomm tanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Tutti li lor coperchi eran sospesi, 122 e fuor n’uscivan sì duri lamenti, 123 che ben parean di miseri e d’offesi.
query.result:
**English:**
121 All their covers were lifted, 122 and from them issued such harsh lamentations, 123 that they clearly seemed to be from the wretched and the wronged.
**Cornish:**
121 An bub an kovrow o vea golow, 122 ha’gas ow a vea ankowgh dhe weles, 123 ow a wra kler dhe oen dhe bobel ha’n gonys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 E io: «Maestro, quai son quelle genti 125 che, seppellite dentro da quell’ arche, 126 si fan sentir coi sospiri dolenti?».
query.result:
**English:**
124 And I: "Master, who are those people 125 who, buried inside those tombs, 126 make themselves heard with their sorrowful sighs?".
**Cornish:**
124 Ha my: "Mester, pyw yw an bobel na 125 ow a veu bejias y'n-mes an bezow na, 126 ow a wra klevys gans ankowgh dolentha?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 E quelli a me: «Qui son li eresïarche 128 con lor seguaci, d’ogne setta, e molto 129 più che non credi son le tombe carche.
query.result:
**English:**
127 And he to me: "Here are the heresiarchs 128 with their followers, of every sect, and much 129 more than you believe are the tombs laden.
**Cornish:**
127 Ha hemma dhe'm: "Yma yw an eresyark 128 gans an dilynoryon, a bub set, ha moy 129 ages na grys tys yw an bezow leun."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Simile qui con simile è sepolto, 131 e i monimenti son più e men caldi». 132 E poi ch’a la man destra si fu vòlto,
133 passammo tra i martìri e li alti spaldi.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Like is buried with like here, 131 and the tombs are more or less hot." 132 And then, when he had turned to the right hand,
133 we passed between the torments and the high ramparts.
**Cornish:**
130 Dell yw hemma gans dell yw bejias, 131 ha'n monymentis moy ha le ages tomm." 132 Ha wosa dhe wrug dhe dhelergh o vea troys,
133 ni a drehedhes ynter an martyris ha'n spaldow ughel.
